description: A small, gentle parakeet with brownish-tinged plumage, a pinkish belly, and blue highlights on the wings and tail. They are known for their calm demeanor.
temperament: Very calm, quiet, and sweet-natured. They are not as active or demanding as budgies and are most active at dawn and dusk.
loudness: Very Quiet. They have a soft, melodious twittering call, making them one of the best choices for those who want a quiet bird.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known to talk. Their vocalizations are limited to soft, pleasant chirps and whistles.
dietaryNeeds: A good-quality parakeet mix, pellets, fresh vegetables, fruits, and sprouted seeds. Enjoy ground foraging and grass seeds.
healthPointers: Generally hardy and can live 15-25 years. Less prone to behavioral issues due to their calm nature. Need a temperature range of 60-85Â°F.
housing: Perfect for apartments. Their quiet nature is a huge plus. A cage that is longer than it is tall is ideal, minimum 24"L x 16"D x 16"H.
